decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using Underworld Breach along with various artifact cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to continuously loop spells from the graveyard. This enables the player to generate a large amount of mana and card advantage to eventually win the game using Thassa's Oracle or Flame of Anor. The deck also includes disruption and protection elements like Spell Pierce and Spell Snare to ensure the combo can be executed successfully. The goal is to quickly set up the combo and overwhelm the opponent with a powerful, game-winning sequence.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to quickly amass a board presence of aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury while controlling the opponent's board with cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison. The deck utilizes versatile spells like Thraben Charm and Galvanic Discharge to deal with threats and protect its own creatures. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Guide of Souls provide additional support and synergy for the deck, allowing it to maintain pressure and finish the game quickly. The land base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent mana sources for the aggressive strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, and Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of colorless mana. The deck focuses on controlling the board through cards like Ugin's Labyrinth, Chalice of the Void, and All Is Dust, while also utilizing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Devourer of Destiny as win conditions. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile tool to search for artifacts and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Mystic Forge and Sowing Mycospawn provide additional card advantage and utility.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Scion of Draco, supported by powerful multi-colored spells like Tribal Flames and Leyline of the Guildpact. The mix of efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding helps keep the opponent's board in check, while counterspells like Stubborn Denial and Spell Snare protect your own threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse array of colors needed for the spells in the deck, ensuring consistent aggression and disruption.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Discharge for extra reach. Ranger-Captain of Eos helps search for key creatures, while Ajani, Nacatl Pariah provides additional support. The deck aims to maintain a fast pace and constantly apply pressure to the opponent, ultimately overpowering them before they have a chance to stabilize. The sideboard likely includes additional removal and disruption to further disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and burn spells. The deck aims to apply pressure early with cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls, while continuously disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Static Prison and Ranger-Captain of Eos. The deck also has strong finishers in Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck seeks to control the battlefield and secure a fast victory.

This deck aims to utilize Underworld Breach to power through the deck and generate infinite storm count by casting multiple spells from the graveyard. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble are key pieces to this combo, allowing for continuous recursion and card draw. Grinding Station is used to mill through the deck quickly, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Thassa's Oracle provide alternate win conditions. Mox Amber and Mox Opal help ramp into the combo quickly, while disruption spells like Spell Pierce and Lightning Bolt help control the board until the combo is assembled.

The main idea of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Thoughtseize and Relic of Progenitus while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Dauthi Voidwalker and Ketramose, the New Dawn. The deck also has a reanimation theme with cards like Ephemerate and Solitude to bring back powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. By combining disruption and aggression, the deck aims to control the game and overwhelm the opponent to secure a victory in a fast-paced 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through hand disruption and removal spells, while also putting pressure on them with aggressive creatures. It also utilizes flicker effects to get additional value from enter-the-battlefield triggers, and has graveyard hate to combat graveyard strategies. The deck aims to control the board and beat down the opponent efficiently, while also generating incremental card advantage through various synergies.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal spells, while also utilizing Narset, Parter of Veils to limit the opponent's card draw. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional control options and card advantage. The deck also utilizes Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion to provide additional value. The mana base includes various fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent color access. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while controlling the board and eventually winning through card advantage and powerful threats.
